results.title: Kill or be Killed
results.creator_credit: Ivan Hall, Ben Vlok and Kavalier
results.brief_description: Featuring top-notch karate action, this film about a kick-off competition between two opposing martial arts coaches offers all the fight scenes any lover of the genre could want. A martial arts champion (James Ryan) is lured to a desert fortress and what he thought would be an Olympic-style contest turns out to be a fight for survival against an army of martial arts gladiators.

results.title: The Haunted house of horror
results.creator_credit: Michael Armstrong, Tony Tenser and Tigon
results.brief_description: A game in an old haunted house is suddenly shattered by uncontrollable violence. As merriment turns to vulnerability, the party-goers try and halt the roller-coaster descent towards madness and the tragic, terrifying climax. Only those with nerves strong enough to witness the psychotic happenings in this House of Horrors, will know what lies waiting in the dark.

results.title: Tourist trap
results.creator_credit: David Schmoeller, J. Larry Carroll and Charles Band Productions
results.brief_description: Molly, it’s only a mannequin - but is it? 2 guys and 3 girls, a broken down car in a deserted backwater, and some weirdo in overalls, a ten gallon hat and rifle in hand, smells like trouble to me. It all begins with one of the guys, rolling his punctured tyre down the road to a petrol station, it seems deserted. Searching for an attendant, he becomes trapped inside a room, with a laughing mannequin in a bed, one smashing through a window, and another swaying back and forth, laughing. Quite a typical horror story, however the mannequins and their eerie qualities make this film very watchable to the bitter end.

results.title: Robinson Crusoe
results.creator_credit: Rene Cardona Jnr, Mario Marzac and Avant Films
results.brief_description: This is the classic tale of the castaway Crusoe, as told by a narrating tiger that witnesses his struggles to survive the man-eating cannibals that have landed on the tropical island where he washed up. Hugo Stiglitz plays Daniel Defoe’s famous hero.

results.title: The Elementary school = Obecna skola
results.creator_credit: Jan Sverak, Jaromir Lukas and Filmove Studio Barrandov
results.brief_description: A new teacher begins work at an elementary school in a small Czechoslovakian town closely following the second World War. This situation provides an historical backdrop for the exploration of a dark period in Czechoslovakian history. Sverak’s debut feature, written by his father (Zdenek Sverak) was the last film to represent the united Czechoslovakia, in the Foreign Language Film category of the 1991 Oscars (it lost to Italy’s entry “Mediterraneo”). Cast includes Jan Triska and Libuse Safrankova. In Czech with English subtitles.

results.title: The Real glory
results.brief_description: Set in 1906, a lonely outpost of American soldiers is left in Manila to train the Philippine Constabulary in the ways of war. They must prevent further uprisings from opposing tribes hidden in the jungle, or face continued oppression. An idealistic Doctor (Gary Cooper) clashes with the captain in charge (and the father of the woman he has fallen in love with), on how the native Moro’s can best be trained, and whether they should defend the outpost or take the battle to the jungle. As the water supply is sabotaged by the jungle tribe, the soldiers and Moros reliant on the precious water face a natural disaster as devastating as the tribal violence, cholera. Based on the novel by Charles L. Clifford. Cast includes Andrea Leeds, David Niven and Reginald Owen.

results.title: Network
results.creator_credit: Sidney Lumet, Howard Gottfried, United Artists Corporation and Paddy Chayefsky
results.brief_description: Sidney Lumet’s “Network” is a dead-on indictment of the TV news media which seems to be growing more relevant with each passing year. Howard Beale is the long-time news anchor for the UBS-TV News. When ratings go down, Beale is fired and suffers an on-air breakdown, announcing that he is going to commit suicide on his final programme. Ironically, his angry rantings boost his ratings - much to the surprise and delight of UBS executives. Subsequently, Beale is re-hired and re-invented as the “mad prophet of the airwaves” and soon becomes a pawn of ruthless programming executives who milk his madness for every share point it’s worth. When the “prophet” ceases to be popular and profitable however, something must be done about Beale, preferably on camera, before a live audience. Cast includes: Faye Dunaway, William Holden, Peter Finch, Robert Duvall, Wesley Addy, Beatrice Straight and Ned Beatty.

results.title: Cruising
results.creator_credit: William Friedkin, Jerry Weintraub and Lorimar Film Entertainment
results.brief_description: On its initial release in 1980, “Cruising” was the target of criticism and protest by gay and lesbian activists who saw it as a negative and destructive portrayal of urban gay life. In retrospect, “Cruising” proves to be one of the most fascinating and chilling dramas about sexuality and violence to come out of Hollywood. Al Pacino plays Steve Burns, a heterosexual cop who has to go undercover in New York’s gay S/M subculture to uncover the identity of a serial killer who is murdering gay young men. As Burns becomes increasingly immersed in the highly sexualised world of gay S/M, he finds his own identity, centred on fixed definitions of gender and monogamous fidelity, challenged by the seductive allure of promiscuity, fast sex and drugs. As the film unfolds, his search for the killer becomes confused by the unleashing of his own repressed desires. Director Friedkin is known for his fast-paced and highly kinetic movies such as “The French connection” and “The Exorcist”, “Cruising” is equally taut and frightening. It is also a film which explores graphically the connections between violence, sexuality, homophobia and masculinity. Far from being a destructive portrayal of gay life, “Cruising” refuses neat sociological positive stereotyping and instead offers chilling insights into the aggressive desires of men, whatever their sexuality. Based on the novel by Gerald Walker.

results.title: Foreign correspondent
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Walter Wanger and Walter Wanger Pictures, Inc.
results.brief_description: This entertaining espionage thriller with a strong supporting cast was one of several made at the time to warn the American public against an isolationist stance towards the events in Europe. It is constructed as a series of climactic set pieces, linked by a play upon the deceptiveness of appearances and the cyclic journey of a couple searching for Nazi spies in London and Holland following the disappearance of a diplomat - a journey which establishes the reporter-hero’s identity. It bears a close relationship to other picaresque thrillers directed by Hitchcock: “The 39 Steps”, “Saboteur” and “North By Northwest”. Cast includes Joel McCrea, Laraine Day, Herbert Marshall and George Sanders.

results.title: Badlands
results.creator_credit: Terrence Malick and Pressman Williams Badlands
results.brief_description: A young couple escape into the badlands of the Mid-West after the boy has dispassionately killed the girl’s unsympathetic father. The screenplay is based on fact, namely the exploits of Chris Starkweather and Caril Filgate in 1958. The film’s originality however arises from the counterpoint between the doomed romanticism courted by Kit and the detached narration by Holly. The story is a provocative study of people numbingly alienated from everyday life. Cast includes Martin Sheen, Sissy Spacek, Raymond Biere and Warren Oates.
